The ancestors of the Zhao clan shared a common origin with Qin. Down to Zhongyan, who served as charioteer to Emperor Da Jia. In later generations, Fei Lian had two sons, and he named one son E Lai, who served King Zhou and was killed by Zhou. His descendants became Qin. E Lai's younger brother was called Ji Sheng, and his descendants became Zhao.
2
å­£å‹ç”Ÿå­Ÿå¢ã€‚ å­Ÿå¢å¹¸æ–¼å‘¨æˆç‹ï¼Œæ˜¯ç‚ºå®…çš‹ç‹¼ã€‚ çš‹ç‹¼ç”Ÿè¡¡çˆ¶ï¼Œè¡¡çˆ¶ç”Ÿé€ çˆ¶ã€‚ é€ çˆ¶å¹¸æ–¼å‘¨ç¹†ç‹ã€‚ é€ çˆ¶å–é©¥ä¹‹ä¹˜åŒ¹ï¼Œèˆ‡æ¡ƒæ—ç›œé©ªã€é©Šé¨®ã€ç¶ è€³ï¼Œç»ä¹‹ç¹†ç‹ã€‚ ç¹†ç‹ä½¿é€ çˆ¶å¾¡ï¼Œè¥¿å·¡ç‹©ï¼Œè¦‹è¥¿ç‹æ¯ï¼Œæ¨‚ä¹‹å¿˜æ­¸ã€‚ è€Œå¾åƒç‹åï¼Œç¹†ç‹æ—¥é¦³åƒé‡Œé¦¬ï¼Œæ”»å¾åƒç‹ï¼Œå¤§ç ´ä¹‹ã€‚ ä¹ƒè³œé€ çˆ¶ä»¥è¶™åŸï¼Œç”±æ­¤ç‚ºè¶™æ°ã€‚
Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng. Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou and was called Zhai Gao Lang. Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu. Zao Fu was favored by King Mu of Zhou. Zao Fu obtained the finest horses from Ji, along with the Peach Forest stallions Li, Hua Liu, and Lu Er, and presented them to King Mu. King Mu had Zao Fu drive the chariot on a western inspection tour where he met the Queen Mother of the West and was so delighted he forgot to return. Then King Xu of Xu rebelled, so King Mu raced a thousand li in one day to attack King Xu of Xu and greatly defeated him. He then granted Zao Fu the city of Zhao, and from this came the Zhao clan.
3
è‡ªé€ çˆ¶å·²ä¸‹å…­ä¸–è‡³å¥„çˆ¶ï¼Œæ›°å…¬ä»²ï¼Œå‘¨å®£ç‹æ™‚ä¼æˆï¼Œç‚ºå¾¡ã€‚ åŠåƒç•æˆ°ï¼Œå¥„çˆ¶è„«å®£ç‹ã€‚ å¥„çˆ¶ç”Ÿå”å¸¶ã€‚ å”å¸¶ä¹‹æ™‚ï¼Œå‘¨å¹½ç‹ç„¡é“ï¼Œå»å‘¨å¦‚æ™‰ï¼Œäº‹æ™‰æ–‡ä¾¯ï¼Œå§‹å»ºè¶™æ°äºæ™‰åœ‹ã€‚
From Zao Fu down six generations to Yan Fu, called Gong Zhong. During King Xuan of Zhou's time, he campaigned against the Rong and served as charioteer. At the battle of Qian Mu, Yan Fu rescued King Xuan. Yan Fu gave birth to Shu Dai. During Shu Dai's time, King You of Zhou was tyrannical, so he left Zhou and went to Jin, serving Marquis Wen of Jin, and first established the Zhao clan in Jin.
4
è‡ªå”å¸¶ä»¥ä¸‹ï¼Œè¶™å®—ç›Šèˆˆï¼Œäº”ä¸–è€Œï¼ˆç”Ÿï¼‰ï¼»è‡³ï¼½è¶™å¤™ã€‚
From Shu Dai downward, the Zhao lineage grew increasingly prominent, and after five generations came Zhao Su.
5
è¶™å¤™ï¼Œæ™‰ç»å…¬ä¹‹åå…­å¹´ä¼éœã€é­ã€è€¿ï¼Œè€Œè¶™å¤™ç‚ºå°‡ä¼éœã€‚ éœå…¬æ±‚å¥”é½Šã€‚ æ™‰å¤§æ—±ï¼Œåœä¹‹ï¼Œæ›°ã€Œéœå¤ªå±±ç‚ºç¥Ÿã€ã€‚ ä½¿è¶™å¤™å¬éœå›æ–¼é½Šï¼Œå¾©ä¹‹ï¼Œä»¥å¥‰éœå¤ªå±±ä¹‹ç¥€ï¼Œæ™‰å¾©ç©°ã€‚ æ™‰ç»å…¬è³œè¶™å¤™è€¿ã€‚
Zhao Su, in the sixteenth year of Duke Xian of Jin, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng, and Zhao Su served as general attacking Huo. The Lord of Huo fled to Qi. Jin suffered a great drought, they divined it, saying 'Mount Tai of Huo is causing the trouble.' They had Zhao Su summon the Lord of Huo from Qi and restore him, to maintain the sacrifices to Mount Tai of Huo, and Jin again became fertile. Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Su Geng.
6
å¤™ç”Ÿå…±å­Ÿï¼Œç•¶é­¯é–”å…¬ä¹‹å…ƒå¹´ä¹Ÿã€‚ å…±å­Ÿç”Ÿè¶™è¡°ï¼Œå­—å­é¤˜ã€‚
Su gave birth to Gong Meng, during the first year of Duke Min of Lu. Gong Meng gave birth to Zhao Shuai, courtesy name Zi Yu.
7
è¶™è¡°åœäº‹æ™‰ç»å…¬åŠè«¸å…¬å­ï¼Œè«å‰ï¼› åœäº‹å…¬å­é‡è€³ï¼Œå‰ï¼Œå³äº‹é‡è€³ã€‚ é‡è€³ä»¥é©ªå§¬ä¹‹äº‚äº¡å¥”ç¿Ÿï¼Œè¶™è¡°å¾ã€‚ ç¿Ÿä¼å»§å’å¦‚ï¼Œå¾—äºŒå¥³ï¼Œç¿Ÿä»¥å…¶å°‘å¥³å¦»é‡è€³ï¼Œé•·å¥³å¦»è¶™è¡°è€Œç”Ÿç›¾ã€‚ åˆï¼Œé‡è€³åœ¨æ™‰æ™‚ï¼Œè¶™è¡°å¦»äº¦ç”Ÿè¶™åŒã€è¶™æ‹¬ã€è¶™å¬°é½Šã€‚ è¶™è¡°å¾é‡è€³å‡ºäº¡ï¼Œå‡¡åä¹å¹´ï¼Œå¾—ååœ‹ã€‚ é‡è€³ç‚ºæ™‰æ–‡å…¬ï¼Œè¶™è¡°ç‚ºåŸå¤§å¤«ï¼Œå±…åŸï¼Œä»»åœ‹æ”¿ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬æ‰€ä»¥ååœ‹åŠéœ¸ï¼Œå¤šè¶™è¡°è¨ˆç­–ï¼Œèªåœ¨æ™‰äº‹ä¸­ã€‚
Zhao Shuai divined serving Duke Xian of Jin and the various princes, none were auspicious; divining serving Prince Chong Er was auspicious, so he served Chong Er. Chong Er fled to the Di due to the Li Ji disturbance, Zhao Shuai followed. The Di attacked Mao Jiu Ru, obtained two women, the Di married the younger daughter to Chong Er, the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai who gave birth to Dun. Initially, when Chong Er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi. Zhao Shuai followed Chong Er in exile, altogether nineteen years, and returned to the state. Chong Er became Duke Wen of Jin, Zhao Shuai became minister of Yuan, resided in Yuan, managed state affairs. The reasons Duke Wen returned to the state and became hegemon were mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, as recorded in the Jin affairs.
8
è¶™è¡°æ—¢åæ™‰ï¼Œæ™‰ä¹‹å¦»å›ºè¦è¿ç¿Ÿå¦»ï¼Œè€Œä»¥å…¶å­ç›¾ç‚ºé©å—£ï¼Œæ™‰å¦»ä¸‰å­çš†ä¸‹äº‹ä¹‹ã€‚ æ™‰è¥„å…¬ä¹‹å…­å¹´ï¼Œè€Œè¶™è¡°å’ï¼Œè¬šç‚ºæˆå­£ã€‚
After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, Jin's wife insisted on welcoming the Di wife, and established her son Dun as the proper heir, Jin's wife's three sons all served him below. In the sixth year of Duke Xiang of Jin, Zhao Shuai died, posthumously titled Cheng Ji.
9
è¶™ç›¾ä»£æˆå­£ä»»åœ‹æ”¿äºŒå¹´è€Œæ™‰è¥„å…¬å’ï¼Œå¤ªå­å¤·çš‹å¹´å°‘ã€‚ ç›¾ç‚ºåœ‹å¤šé›£ï¼Œæ¬²ç«‹è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿé›ã€‚ é›æ™‚åœ¨ç§¦ï¼Œä½¿ä½¿è¿ä¹‹ã€‚ å¤ªå­æ¯æ—¥å¤œå•¼æ³£ï¼Œé “é¦–è¬‚è¶™ç›¾æ›°ï¼šã€Œå…ˆå›ä½•ç½ªï¼Œé‡‹å…¶é©å­è€Œæ›´æ±‚å›ï¼Ÿã€ è¶™ç›¾æ‚£ä¹‹ï¼Œæå…¶å®—èˆ‡å¤§å¤«è¥²èª…ä¹‹ï¼Œä¹ƒé‚ç«‹å¤ªå­ï¼Œæ˜¯ç‚ºéˆå…¬ï¼Œç™¼å…µè·æ‰€è¿è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿæ–¼ç§¦è€…ã€‚ éˆå…¬æ—¢ç«‹ï¼Œè¶™ç›¾ç›Šå°ˆåœ‹æ”¿ã€‚
Zhao Dun succeeded Cheng Ji in managing state affairs for two years when Duke Xiang of Jin died, Crown Prince Yi Gao was young. Dun, because the state had many difficulties, wanted to establish Duke Xiang's younger brother Yong. Yong was then in Qin, sent envoys to welcome him. The crown prince's mother day and night wept, kowtowing to Zhao Dun saying: 'What crime did my late lord commit, abandoning his proper son and seeking another lord?' Zhao Dun was troubled by this, fearing his clan and the ministers would attack and execute him, so he established the crown prince, this was Duke Ling, and sent troops to block those welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin. After Duke Ling ascended, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.
10
éˆå…¬ç«‹åå››å¹´ï¼Œç›Šé©•ã€‚ è¶™ç›¾é©Ÿè««ï¼Œéˆå…¬å¼—è½ã€‚ åŠé£Ÿç†Šè¹¯ï¼Œèƒ¹ä¸ç†Ÿï¼Œæ®ºå®°äººï¼ŒæŒå…¶å°¸å‡ºï¼Œè¶™ç›¾è¦‹ä¹‹ã€‚ éˆå…¬ç”±æ­¤æ‡¼ï¼Œæ¬²æ®ºç›¾ã€‚ ç›¾ç´ ä»æ„›äººï¼Œå˜—æ‰€é£Ÿæ¡‘ä¸‹é¤“äººåææ•‘ç›¾ï¼Œç›¾ä»¥å¾—äº¡ã€‚ æœªå‡ºå¢ƒï¼Œè€Œè¶™ç©¿å¼’éˆå…¬è€Œç«‹è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿé»‘è‡€ï¼Œæ˜¯ç‚ºæˆå…¬ã€‚ è¶™ç›¾å¾©åï¼Œä»»åœ‹æ”¿ã€‚ å›å­è­ç›¾ã€Œç‚ºæ­£å¿ï¼Œäº¡ä¸å‡ºå¢ƒï¼Œåä¸è¨è³Šã€ï¼Œæ•…å¤ªå²æ›¸æ›°ã€Œè¶™ç›¾å¼’å…¶å›ã€ã€‚ æ™‰æ™¯å…¬æ™‚è€Œè¶™ç›¾å’ï¼Œè¬šç‚ºå®£å­Ÿï¼Œå­æœ”å—£ã€‚
Duke Ling ascended for fourteen years, becoming increasingly arrogant. Zhao Dun repeatedly remonstrated, Duke Ling did not listen. When eating bear paw, it was not cooked thoroughly, he killed the cook, held the corpse out, Zhao Dun saw it. Duke Ling from this became fearful, wanting to kill Dun. Dun was always benevolent and loved people, once a hungry person he fed under the mulberry tree later defended and saved Dun, Dun thereby escaped. Before leaving the borders, Zhao Chuan assassinated Duke Ling and established Duke Xiang's younger brother Hei Tun, this was Duke Cheng. Zhao Dun returned again, managed state affairs. The gentleman criticizes Dun 'as chief minister, in exile did not leave the borders, returning did not punish the traitor', therefore the Grand Historian wrote 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord.' During Duke Jing of Jin's time Zhao Dun died, posthumously titled Xuan Meng, son Shuo succeeded.
11
è¶™æœ”ï¼Œæ™‰æ™¯å…¬ä¹‹ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæœ”ç‚ºæ™‰å°‡ä¸‹è»æ•‘é„­ï¼Œèˆ‡æ¥šèŠç‹æˆ°æ²³ä¸Šã€‚ æœ”å¨¶æ™‰æˆå…¬å§Šç‚ºå¤«äººã€‚
Zhao Shuo, in the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, Shuo served as Jin's lower army general to save Zheng, battled Chu King Zhuang on the river. Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as wife.
12
æ™‰æ™¯å…¬ä¹‹ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œå¤§å¤«å± å²¸è³ˆæ¬²èª…è¶™æ°ã€‚ åˆï¼Œè¶™ç›¾åœ¨æ™‚ï¼Œå¤¢è¦‹å”å¸¶æŒè¦è€Œå“­ï¼Œç”šæ‚²ï¼› å·²è€Œç¬‘ï¼Œæ‹Šæ‰‹ä¸”æ­Œã€‚ ç›¾åœä¹‹ï¼Œå…†çµ•è€Œå¾Œå¥½ã€‚ è¶™å²æ´å ä¹‹ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤å¤¢ç”šæƒ¡ï¼Œéå›ä¹‹èº«ï¼Œä¹ƒå›ä¹‹å­ï¼Œç„¶äº¦å›ä¹‹å’ã€‚ è‡³å­«ï¼Œè¶™å°‡ä¸–ç›Šè¡°ã€‚ã€ å± å²¸è³ˆè€…ï¼Œå§‹æœ‰å¯µæ–¼éˆå…¬ï¼ŒåŠè‡³æ–¼æ™¯å…¬è€Œè³ˆç‚ºå¸å¯‡ï¼Œå°‡ä½œé›£ï¼Œä¹ƒæ²»éˆå…¬ä¹‹è³Šä»¥è‡´è¶™ç›¾ï¼Œéå‘Šè«¸å°‡æ›°ï¼šã€Œç›¾é›–ä¸çŸ¥ï¼ŒçŒ¶ç‚ºè³Šé¦–ã€‚ ä»¥è‡£å¼’å›ï¼Œå­å­«åœ¨æœï¼Œä½•ä»¥æ‡²ç½ªï¼Ÿ è«‹èª…ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ éŸ“å¥æ›°ï¼šã€Œéˆå…¬é‡è³Šï¼Œè¶™ç›¾åœ¨å¤–ï¼Œå¾å…ˆå›ä»¥ç‚ºç„¡ç½ªï¼Œæ•…ä¸èª…ã€‚ ä»Šè«¸å›å°‡èª…å…¶å¾Œï¼Œæ˜¯éå…ˆå›ä¹‹æ„è€Œä»Šå¦„èª…ã€‚ å¦„èª…è¬‚ä¹‹äº‚ã€‚ è‡£æœ‰å¤§äº‹è€Œå›ä¸èï¼Œæ˜¯ç„¡å›ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ å± å²¸è³ˆä¸è½ã€‚ éŸ“å¥å‘Šè¶™æœ”è¶£äº¡ã€‚ æœ”ä¸è‚¯ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå­å¿…ä¸çµ•è¶™ç¥€ï¼Œæœ”æ­»ä¸æ¨ã€‚ã€ éŸ“å¥è¨±è«¾ï¼Œç¨±ç–¾ä¸å‡ºã€‚ è³ˆä¸è«‹è€Œæ“…èˆ‡è«¸å°‡æ”»è¶™æ°æ–¼ä¸‹å®®ï¼Œæ®ºè¶™æœ”ã€è¶™åŒã€è¶™æ‹¬ã€è¶™å¬°é½Šï¼Œçš†æ»…å…¶æ—ã€‚
In the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, minister Tu An Jia wanted to execute the Zhao clan. Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, he dreamed of Shu Dai holding his waist and crying, very sorrowful; then laughed, clapped hands and sang. Dun divined it, the omen was broken then good. Zhao historian Yuan interpreted it, saying: 'This dream is very bad, not for your body, but for your son, yet it is also your fault.' To the grandson, the Zhao lineage will increasingly decline.' Tu An Jia, initially favored by Duke Ling, by Duke Jing's time Jia was Minister of Justice, about to create disorder, so he investigated Duke Ling's assassins to implicate Zhao Dun, widely told the generals: 'Though Dun did not know, he was still the head of the traitors.' With ministers assassinating their lord, descendants in court, how to punish crime?' Please execute them.' Han Jue said: 'Duke Ling encountered assassins, Zhao Dun was abroad, my late lord considered him innocent, therefore did not execute.' Now you gentlemen will execute his descendants, this is not my late lord's intention but now rashly executing.' Rash execution is called chaos.' Ministers have great matters but the lord does not hear, this is having no lord.' Tu An Jia did not listen. Han Jue told Zhao Shuo to quickly flee. Shuo refused, saying: 'You must not cut off the Zhao sacrifices, Shuo dies without regret.' Han Jue promised, feigned illness and did not go out. Jia without permission arbitrarily with the generals attacked the Zhao clan at the Lower Palace, killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi, all exterminated their clans.
13

Zhao Shuo's wife was Duke Cheng's elder sister, had a posthumous pregnancy, fled to the palace and hid. Zhao Shuo's guest named Gong Sun Chu Jiu, Chu Jiu told Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?' Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has a posthumous pregnancy, if luckily a boy, I will support him;' if a girl, I will slowly die.' After not long, Shuo's wife gave birth, bore a boy. Tu An Jia heard of it, searched in the palace. The lady placed the child and cursed the crack diviner saying: 'If the Zhao lineage is extinguished, cry;' if not extinguished, make no sound.' When searched, the child ultimately made no sound. Already escaped, Cheng Ying told Gong Sun Chu Jiu: 'Now one search did not find, later must search again, what to do?' Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Establishing the orphan or dying, which is harder?' Cheng Ying said: 'Dying is easy, establishing the orphan is hard.' Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'The Zhao clan's late lords treated you generously, you be strong for the hard one, I will do the easy one, please let me die first.' So the two plotted to take another's infant child and carry it, clothed in embroidered robe, hid in the mountains. Cheng Ying went out, falsely told the generals: 'Ying is unworthy, cannot establish the Zhao orphan.' Who can give me a thousand jin, I will tell the Zhao orphan's location.' The generals all rejoiced, promised him, dispatched troops following Cheng Ying to attack Gong Sun Chu Jiu. Chu Jiu falsely said: 'Petty man Cheng Ying!' Formerly in the Lower Palace difficulty could not die, conspired with me to hide the Zhao orphan child, now again sells me.' Even if cannot establish, how can bear to sell!' Holding the child called: 'Heaven, heaven!' What crime has the Zhao orphan?' Please let him live, killing Chu Jiu alone is acceptable.' The generals did not permit, so killed Chu Jiu and the orphan child. The generals thought the Zhao orphan was truly dead, all rejoiced. But the Zhao true orphan was actually elsewhere, Cheng Ying ultimately hid with him in the mountains.

å±…åäº”å¹´ï¼Œæ™‰æ™¯å…¬ç–¾ï¼Œåœä¹‹ï¼Œå¤§æ¥­ä¹‹å¾Œä¸é‚è€…ç‚ºç¥Ÿã€‚ æ™¯å…¬å•éŸ“å¥ï¼Œå¥çŸ¥è¶™å­¤åœ¨ï¼Œä¹ƒæ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤§æ¥­ä¹‹å¾Œåœ¨æ™‰çµ•ç¥€è€…ï¼Œå…¶è¶™æ°ä¹ï¼Ÿ å¤«è‡ªä¸­è¡è€…çš†å¬´å§“ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸­è¡äººé¢é³¥å™£ï¼Œé™ä½æ®·å¸å¤§æˆŠï¼ŒåŠå‘¨å¤©å­ï¼Œçš†æœ‰æ˜å¾·ã€‚ ä¸‹åŠå¹½å²ç„¡é“ï¼Œè€Œå”å¸¶å»å‘¨é©æ™‰ï¼Œäº‹å…ˆå›æ–‡ä¾¯ï¼Œè‡³äºæˆå…¬ï¼Œä¸–æœ‰ç«‹åŠŸï¼Œæœªå˜—çµ•ç¥€ã€‚ ä»Šå¾å›ç¨æ»…è¶™å®—ï¼Œåœ‹äººå“€ä¹‹ï¼Œæ•…è¦‹é¾œç­–ã€‚ å”¯å›åœ–ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ™¯å…¬å•ï¼šã€Œè¶™å°šæœ‰å¾Œå­å­«ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ éŸ“å¥å…·ä»¥å¯¦å‘Šã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯æ™¯å…¬ä¹ƒèˆ‡éŸ“å¥è¬€ç«‹è¶™å­¤å…’ï¼Œå¬è€ŒåŒ¿ä¹‹å®®ä¸­ã€‚ è«¸å°‡å…¥å•ç–¾ï¼Œæ™¯å…¬å› éŸ“å¥ä¹‹çœ¾ä»¥è„…è«¸å°‡è€Œè¦‹è¶™å­¤ã€‚ è¶™å­¤åæ›°æ­¦ã€‚ è«¸å°‡ä¸å¾—å·²ï¼Œä¹ƒæ›°ï¼šã€Œæ˜”ä¸‹å®®ä¹‹é›£ï¼Œå± å²¸è³ˆç‚ºä¹‹ï¼ŒçŸ¯ä»¥å›å‘½ï¼Œå¹¶å‘½ç¾¤è‡£ã€‚ éç„¶ï¼Œå­°æ•¢ä½œé›£ï¼ å¾®å›ä¹‹ç–¾ï¼Œç¾¤è‡£å›ºä¸”è«‹ç«‹è¶™å¾Œã€‚ ä»Šå›æœ‰å‘½ï¼Œç¾¤è‡£ä¹‹é¡˜ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯å¬è¶™æ­¦ã€ç¨‹å¬°éæ‹œè«¸å°‡ï¼Œé‚åèˆ‡ç¨‹å¬°ã€è¶™æ­¦æ”»å± å²¸è³ˆï¼Œæ»…å…¶æ—ã€‚ å¾©èˆ‡è¶™æ­¦ç”°é‚‘å¦‚æ•…ã€‚
After fifteen years, Duke Jing of Jin became ill, divined it, the descendants of great enterprises who did not succeed were causing trouble. Duke Jing asked Han Jue, Jue knew the Zhao orphan was there, so said: 'Among the descendants of great enterprises in Jin who cut off sacrifices, is it the Zhao clan?' Indeed from Zhongyan all are Ying surname.' Zhongyan had human face bird beak, descended to assist Yin Emperor Da Jia, and Zhou kings, all had bright virtue.' Down to Kings You and Li without way, and Shu Dai left Zhou went to Jin, served my late lord Wen Hou, down to Duke Cheng, generations established merit, never cut off sacrifices. Now my lord alone extinguished the Zhao lineage, the people of the state pity it, therefore appears in the turtle and milfoil.' Only my lord decide it.' Duke Jing asked: 'Does Zhao still have descendants?' Han Jue fully told him the truth. Duke Jing then conspired with Han Jue to establish the Zhao orphan, summoned and hid him in the palace. The generals entered to inquire about the illness, Duke Jing used Han Jue's forces to threaten the generals and show them the Zhao orphan. The Zhao orphan was named Wu. The generals had no choice but said: 'The former Lower Palace difficulty, Tu An Jia did it, forged the lord's command, and commanded all ministers.' If not so, who would dare create disorder!' Without my lord's illness, the ministers would certainly have requested to establish the Zhao successor.' Now my lord has command, it is the ministers' wish.' Then summoned Zhao Wu and Cheng Ying to bow to all the generals, then turned and with Cheng Ying and Zhao Wu attacked Tu An Jia, exterminated his clan. Restored Zhao Wu's fields and cities as before.

When Zhao Wu came of age, became an adult, Cheng Ying then resigned from the ministers, told Zhao Wu: 'In the former Lower Palace difficulty, all could die.' They considered me able to accomplish matters, therefore died before me;' now if I do not repay, this makes my matters unaccomplished.' Therefore repay them first, then kill myself.' Reporting favors to Zhao has no precedence or posteriority.'

Two years later, in the fourteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Fan and Zhonghang rebelled. The next year in spring, Jian Zi told Handan minister Wu: 'Return to me five hundred families of Wei soldiers, I will station them in Jinyang.' Wu promised, returned and his father and brothers did not listen, went back on his word. Zhao Yang captured Wu, imprisoned him in Jinyang. Then told the Handan people: 'I am personally executing Wu, whom do you gentlemen want to establish?' So killed Wu. Zhao Ji and She Bin with Handan rebelled. The Jin lord sent Ji Qin to besiege Handan. Xun Yin and Fan Ji She were friendly with Wu, did not want to help Qin and plotted rebellion, Dong An Yu knew of it. Tenth month, Fan and Zhonghang attacked Zhao Yang, Yang fled to Jinyang, Jin people besieged it. Fan Ji She's enemy Wei Xiang and others plotted to drive out Xun Yin, using Liang Ying Fu to replace him; drove out Ji She, using Fan Gao Yi to replace him. Xun Yue spoke to the Jin lord: 'Your lordship commands ministers, those who start disorder die.' Now these three ministers started disorder but only drove out Yang, using punishment unequally, please drive them all out.' Eleventh month, Xun Yue, Han Bu Ning, Wei Duo following the lord's command attacked Fan and Zhonghang, did not succeed. Fan and Zhonghang counterattacked the lord, the lord struck them, Fan and Zhonghang defeated and fled. Ding wei day, the two sons fled to Chaoge. Fan Ji She fled to Zhongqiu. Qi Wu said: 'Formerly my worthy uncle and the Handan difficulty, the Zhao clan truly consolidated it.' With Zhao clan then there is Qi clan, without Zhao clan then there is no Qi clan.' Leave it, why?' So stopped. The Zhao clan exile did not leave Jin borders, ended with Zhao Yang. Twelfth year, Zhao Yang died, son Jian Zi Guan ascended. Jian Zi third year, moved to Jinyang. Fifth year, attacked Wei, took Zhong Mou.

Zhao Xuan Zi held the government and attacked Qi, achieving military merit. On the fourth month xin si day, Ji presented his armor in the court. Xuan Zi said: 'Abandoning government is punishable by execution.' Ji said: 'People say: 'A hen does not crow at dawn.'' If a hen crows at dawn, the family will be finished.'' Now you lend the government, lending government is a hen crowing at dawn.' People cannot overcome anger, your servant dares not translate.' Zhao Dun secretly hid Xi Ji in Shen and gave birth to Zhao Shuo. Shuo married Zhuang Ji. Dun died, Shuo ascended. Shuo died, Shuo's wife had a posthumous pregnancy, fled to the palace and gave birth to Zhao Wu. Ying Qi deceived and killed Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi, and all their clans were exterminated. Wu then counterattacked and killed Ying Qi, welcomed Zhao Wu from Jinyang and established him. This was Zhao Wen Zi. Wen Zi gave birth to Jing Shu. During Jing Shu's time, Duke Jing of Qi sent Yan Ying to Jin, and Yan Ying spoke with Shu Xiang of Jin. Yan Ying said: 'Among Qi's government being late, the lord's extravagance, and lord and ministers oversteppingâ€”among these four things, which will perish first?' Shu Xiang said: 'What four things are you speaking of?' Yan Ying said: 'Formerly, the Qi lord was repeatedly defeated by Cui Zhu and killed him.' Cui Zhu's sons together killed Lord Guang of Qi because of the Cui clan disturbance.' Ministers wish to be wealthy but Yan poor, the lord wishes to be happy but ministers labor.' If these two are not done, who will do them?' Shu Xiang said: 'This is also the lord's desire, but ministers carry it outâ€”from carrying it out to overstepping, from carrying it out to deceiving, from carrying it out to executing, what they follow is the same.'

Jian Zi said: 'I was greatly delighted in the imperial place, touring with the hundred spirits in the celestial sphere, with vast music of nine movements and ten thousand dances, not like the music of the three dynasties, its sound moved the heart.' Zhao Su, in the sixteenth year of Duke Xian of Jin, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng, and Zhao Su served as general attacking Huo. The Lord of Huo fled to Qi. Jin then enfeoffed Zhao Su with Geng. Zhao Su was not in Jin, so the people became chaotic and welcomed Zhao Su to establish him. This was Duke Wen of Jin. He gave birth to Yuan Tong, Ping Kuo, and Lou He. Duke Wen of Jin died, and his son Duke Xiang Qu ascended.

Yan Ying said: 'Formerly, the Qi lord was repeatedly defeated by Cui Zhu and killed him.' Cui Zhu's sons together killed Lord Guang of Qi because of the Cui clan disturbance.' The hegemon's son will moreover make your state have no distinction between men and women.' Dong An Yu received the words and wrote to hide them.' Thus returning to antiquity cannot be criticized, and following ritual is not sufficiently praiseworthy. Moreover, wearing strange clothing leads to licentious ambitions, but this means Zou and Lu have no extraordinary conduct; when customs are deviant the people are easily led astray, but this means Wu and Yue have no outstanding scholars. Moreover, sages call benefiting the body 'clothing', call facilitating affairs 'ritual'. The regulations of advancing and retreating, the systems of clothingâ€”these are for regulating ordinary people, not for discussing worthy people. Therefore ordinary people follow customs and flow with them, worthy people follow change together with it. Therefore the proverb says 'Using books to control chariots does not exhaust the horse's feelings, using ancient systems to control the present does not reach the changes of affairs.' In the twentieth year, the king attacked Zhongshan territory, reaching Ning Jia; west he attacked Hu territory, reaching Yu Zhong. The Lin Hu king offered horses. In the twenty-first year, he attacked Zhongshan. Zhao Chan served as right army, Xu Ju served as left army, Prince Zhang served as center army, Wang Jian served as assistant general. He took Eyang city, attacked Chi Li and Yi An. Li Dui led Hu and Di troops as assistant general. With ten thousand troops he attacked Zhongshan and captured it. Zhao Qi served as commander for attacking and taking, together with Yan Ju attacked Xiang and captured it. Then captured Yan army, burned Qi boats. In the twenty-third year, he attacked Song. Prince Chao served as right army, Sima Kui led left army, Su Li served as assistant general. They took Song minister Niu Shou.

In the twenty-fourth year, he attacked Wei. Jian served as commander of the generals, defeated Wei army, beheaded fifteen thousand. Took Wei Miao Qiu, Yu Qiu, Xu Zhou. In the twenty-sixth year, he again attacked Zhongshan, expanded territory north to Yan and Dai, west to Yun Zhong and Jiu Yuan. Fei Yi advised: 'Exceeding and being able to return, though lowly will certainly be noble; losing and not being able to return, though noble will certainly be lowly. Your servant wishes to have an end.'

Third year, Qin attacked Wei, took our An Yi. Fourth year, Qin attacked Han, took Zhao city. Gao Xin immediately fought with the king. Now Qin attacks the three Jin, Zhao attacks Qi, Qin gets the three Jin, Zhao gets Qi, Qin then attacks Zhao. Now Qin attacks Qi, Zhao attacks the three Jin, Qin gets Qi, Zhao gets the three Jin, Qin then attacks Zhao. Now Qin attacks the three Jin, Zhao attacks Qi, Qin gets the three Jin, Zhao gets Qi, Qin then attacks Zhao. Now Qin attacks Qi, Zhao attacks the three Jin, Qin gets Qi, Zhao gets the three Jin, Qin then attacks Zhao. The Empress Dowager said: "Your lordship is wrong, it is not as serious as with Chang'an Jun." The Left Minister Tang Ju said: "Parents who love their children plan deeply for them. When the old woman sent off the Yan Queen, holding her heels, weeping for her, thinking of her distance, it was also pitiable. After she left, it is not that she did not think of her, at sacrifices she prayed saying 'May she never return', was this not planning for the long term, for her sons and grandsons to succeed as kings?" The Empress Dowager said: "Yes." The Left Minister said: "Now going back three generations, among the sons and grandsons of Zhao lords who became marquises, are there any whose succession still exists?" She said: "There are none." He said: "Not only Zhao, are there any among the feudal lords whose succession still exists?" She said: "This old woman has not heard of any." He said: "This is because those close suffered calamity in their own persons, those far suffered calamity in their sons and grandsons. Is it that the sons of lords who become marquises are not good? Their position is honored but without merit, their emolument is generous but without labor, and they monopolize many heavy treasures. Now your ladyship honors Chang'an Jun's position, and enfeoffs him with fertile lands, gives him many heavy treasures, but does not make him have merit for the state now. Once the mountain tomb collapses, how will Chang'an Jun entrust himself to Zhao? This old minister considers your ladyship's planning for Chang'an Jun to be short-sighted, therefore considers your love for him inferior to the Yan Queen's." The Empress Dowager said: "Yes, I leave it to your lordship to do as you wish." Thereupon they prepared a hundred chariots for Chang'an Jun, sent him as hostage to Qi, and Qi troops then came out.

Fifth year, Dai territory greatly shook, from Le Xu westward, north to Ping Yin, towers houses walls mostly destroyed, ground cracked east-west 130 paces. Sixth year, great famine, people falsely said: 'Zhao will wail, Qin will laugh. If you do not believe, look at the ground growing hair.'

Seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao great general Li Mu, general Sima Shang led, struck them. Li Mu executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them. Zhao Cong's army broken, Yan Ju fled away. King Qian surrendered.

Eighth year tenth month, Handan became Qin.

The Grand Historian says. I heard Feng Wang Sun say: 'Zhao king Qian, his mother was a singing girl, favored by Dao Xiang Wang. Dao Xiang Wang deposed rightful son Jia and established Qian. Qian originally had no conduct, believed slander, therefore executed his good general Li Mu, used Guo Kai.' Was this not absurd! Qin having captured Qian, Zhao's fugitive officials together established Jia as king, reigned in Dai for six years, Qin advanced troops broke Jia, then extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.
